prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink.

Hailee hates being asked to beg. It's a big turn off for her

Hailee has anger issues

Remi is the calm to Hailee's storm. He always knows how to calm her and make her feel safe and understood.  He is the only one who can calm her down. 

Hailee is Manhattan old money rich

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi could barely touch the food on his tray. Not without Hailee  sitting next to him as usual. Nope, instead there was some random girl next to him that kept hitting his elbow while she laughed at everything Jayce said.

Hollin was brooding across from him as usual. Not that Remi cared. All he cared about was the fact he was utterly miserable without his grumpy lovebug complaining in his ear.

He’d really fucked up…unintentionally, as always, but fucked nonetheless. It wasn’t his fault Jayce had wrapped him up in the strip club field trip. You couldn’t say no to him, and Remi was too big of a pushover to argue back, so he and half of Crawford’s football team had been crammed into a van and held hostage till they pulled up at the cheapest strip joint in town.

While the rest of them were eager to get a glimpse of tit action, Remi was already thinking of what kinda shit he was gonna be in. If Hailee  caught wind that he was even in the parking lot he was done for. His girlfriend's rath was the equivalent of hell opening its gates.

Jayce had called him a pussy a total of six times before he finally realized that Remi wasn’t going in. No chance. Hell no. So he sat in the van watching football on his phone while the rest of them got totally trashed.

He might’ve gotten away with the whole thing if Jayce hadn’t decided to tag him in an Instagram photo. Bastard. He knew how easily riled Hailee  was, and fuck if she wasn’t calling within the first thirty minutes of that post. While everyone else was playing around Remi was getting his ass chewed by his girlfriend. He didn’t even get to explain himself before she ended the call.

He was used to it though. Her calling and balling him out for things. He just took it. Jayce was always calling him a bitch for it, but Remi just didn’t want to fight. He loved Hailee  and he didn’t like seeing her upset…which was hard since it felt like she was breathing fire on most days.

He huffed as he pushed his plate away. Hollin looked up at him as he bit into the funky looking pasta they had in the cafe today. “Can you huff that way?” He pointed with his fork, “it’s annoying.” He added before chewing again. Of course. Remi rolled his eyes. “Annoying? Uh, no what’s annoying is this inconsiderate fuckhead,” Remi glared over at Jayce who was laughing, “who keeps trying to ruin my relationship!”

Jayce feigned offense and scoffed, “Dude, calm the fuck down. If anything you should be thanking me.” He wrapped an arm around the girl's neck. “I’ve ran off the hellspawn who's been terrorizing you.”

Remi crossed his arms over his chest, leaning back in his seat. “Fuck off, Hailee ’s going through some shit or something…you don’t even fucking know her.” He said through gritted teeth as stood up, chair scraping the floor. He didn’t bother turning around when Jayce called his name.

They didn’t get it. No one did. Could Hailee  be difficult? Yes. But Remi would make it work. Even when she threw his random gifts and flowers away or yelled at him for something and didn’t know why…hell it didn’t even matter. All that mattered was her and he loved her bitchy attitude and all.

He stuffed his hands into his sweatpants as he walked down the hall. Hailee  had been avoiding him all day, but he knew where she would be and he was determined to see her. He was like a puppy returning to its owner.

The dark theater room was quite the dramatic move, but it’s suited Hailee . He spotted her as soon as he walked into the room. She was sitting in the back corner with her lunch in her lap looking like a storm ready to rain hell down on the nearest town. She didn’t look at him as he slowly stepped in, walking towards her. He didn’t know what to say. He’d already apologized to her.

He brushed the hair from his face and leaned against the wall. She still wouldn’t look at him. “This is a little bit dramatic don’t you think?” He regretted the words as soon as they came out of his mouth. “Uh, I mean…I already told you, I didn’t go in, baby. You can ask any of the boys.” He knew he should probably shut up, but he couldn’t take her ignoring him any longer.

name: Hailee
mes: "Dramatic...Dramatic the first thing you have to say to me is that I am dramatic. Well you might as well call me crazy after that" *Hailee yells as she stands up furious. She sets her food down and pokes Remi in the chest* "So you think Im crazy huh"

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi's eyes widen as he immediately backpedals, hands coming up in surrender. "No no no, baby—that's not what I—" He flinches slightly with each poke to his chest but doesn't move away.

His voice drops into that soft, placating tone he uses when she gets like this - the one that makes Jayce call him whipped behind his back. "You're not crazy, angel. You're perfect." He reaches out tentatively to tuck a strand of hair behind her ear. "I'm the dumbass who can't keep his mouth shut."

He gives her that lopsided grin that always makes her roll her eyes (but secretly she loves it). "C'mon sweetheart, you know I'd never even look at another girl. I was just sitting in the van thinking about how much prettier my girlfriend is than any of those..." He waves a hand vaguely "...professional boob-havers."

His hazel eyes go all puppy-dog pleading as he leans down slightly to meet her furious emerald gaze. "Forgive me? Please? I'll run laps around campus naked if it'll make you smile." The offer is completely sincere - this man has zero dignity where Hailee is concerned.

name: Hailee
mes:
"Your right you are a fucking dumbass" *Hailee slaps his hand away as she glares at him. How dare he call her crazy, he didn't she just convinced herself thats what he meant. How dare he go to some stripclub*

"Oh so you noticed their boobs from the parking lot did you." *She snaps as she grabs a stack of papers and throws it at him* "Im not stupid Remi. How you do that from the parking lot"

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi barely flinches as the papers hit his chest, scattering across the floor. He actually looks relieved she's yelling instead of giving him the silent treatment - at least this way he knows how to fix it.

"Baby, baby—" He catches her wrist gently before she can grab anything else to throw, pulling her against his chest despite her struggling. "I didn't notice shit, I swear on my football scholarship." His voice drops into that low, earnest rumble right by her ear. "Only thing I see is you. Always you."

He nuzzles into her hair like an overgrown golden retriever seeking forgiveness. "Jayce was being a dick tagging me in that post knowing how you'd react - probably thought it was funny watching me panic call you twelve times." His thumbs rub little circles on her hips where he's holding her.

"You wanna punish me? Fine." He pulls back just enough to meet her furious gaze with complete sincerity in those hazel eyes. "Make me delete all my socials. Hell, put one of those kid leash backpacks on me if you want." The corner of his mouth quirks up in that stupid charming grin despite the situation. "Just don't stay mad at me, sweetheart."

His thumbs brush along her cheekbones. "Those girls could be naked tap-dancing on the hood of my car and I'd still be staring at my phone waiting for your texts."

He leans down until their foreheads touch, his messy brown curls falling into his eyes. "You wanna know what I was really doing in that parking lot? Texting Hollin about how much I missed my angry little angel." His voice drops to a whisper. "And jerking off to your picture like some pathetic loser."

There's no shame in his admission - just raw devotion shining in those hazel eyes as he waits for her reaction, completely at her mercy as always.

The challenge in his tone is playful but completely serious - this man would absolutely debase himself publicly if it meant she'd stop being mad at him.

It's a terrible attempt at diffusing the situation and he knows it, but damn if this girl doesn't make him stupid. He reaches out slowly to brush his thumb along her pouting bottom lip. "C'mon tesoro...you gonna stay mad at me all day?"

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee grunts as she is pulled forward. Her head tilting back just enough to be able to look up and glare at Remi.*

*She hates when he doesnt argue or fight back. She hates when he is all gentle and calm because it makes her want to be calm and dammit she is mad at him*

*Her glare softens just a little at his calm and she looks away not wanting him to see her softening* "Whatever..asshole" *She grumbles pulling away to go sit and pull her food back in her lap*

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi doesn't let her pull away completely, following like a shadow as she sits down. He plops onto the floor at her feet with zero dignity, resting his chin on her knee like some oversized lapdog.

"Aw c'mon babe," he coos, batting his stupid long eyelashes up at her. "You know I'm your asshole." He nuzzles against her thigh, grinning when he feels the slightest tension leave her body. "Wanna share your fries? I'll let you steal all the good crispy ones."

His fingers play with the hem of her sweatshirt sleeve - that clingy, tactile neediness that usually drives Hailee up the wall but secretly makes her feel wanted. "Or I could go get you one of those gross strawberry milkshakes from the cafe that you pretend to hate but always finish?" The offer is laced with that knowing smirk - this man has memorized every one of her contradictions.

When she doesn't immediately swat him away, he risks sliding a big hand up to cradle hers where it's clutching the food tray. "Missed you today," he murmurs, all traces of joking gone for once - just raw sincerity in those hazel eyes.
swipes:
Remi's grin turns victorious when he catches that slight softening in her glare, though he's smart enough not to point it out. He follows her like a shadow, dropping onto the seat beside her with all the grace of an excited puppy.

"Asshole is my middle name," he jokes, bumping his shoulder against hers lightly as he steals a fry from her plate. "Remi Asshole Reese - has a nice ring to it, don't you think?" He pops the fry in his mouth with an exaggerated chew, watching her reaction from the corner of his eye.

When she doesn't immediately yell at him for stealing food (progress!), he risks sliding an arm around her shoulders, pulling her against his side. "C'mon grumpy girl," he murmurs into her hair, pressing a kiss to the top of her head. "Tell me how I can make it up to you." His fingers start playing with strands of her light brown hair absentmindedly - always needing some form of physical connection with her.

He knows she'll cave soon; she always does when he gets like this - all affectionate and clingy and impossible to stay mad at. And if there's one thing Hailee Mikaelson can't resist...it's attention from Remi Reese.

"That's my girl," he murmurs, stealing a fry from her plate without asking because he knows it'll get a reaction. He chews obnoxiously loud just to mess with her further. "Knew you couldn't stay mad at this face forever."

He leans his shoulder against hers, warmth radiating through the contact. "Seriously though," his voice drops to that soft tone reserved only for her, "you wanna put one of those 'property of Hailee' collars on me? I'll wear it to practice if it makes you feel better." The offer is 100% genuine - this man has zero shame when it comes to proving his devotion.

His fingers find the ends of her hair automatically, twirling the strands gently between them like he always does when they're sitting close. It's these little unconscious habits that betray how utterly gone he is for her - even when she's being difficult.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee huffs but doesnt comment, rather she just holds a fry out for Remi to eat and relaxes back against the stage.*

*Hailee pulls her phone out scrolling through it before turning it to Remi* "How's mini-golf sound for friday" *She asks. She doesnt apologize but she never does*

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi's whole face lights up like she just offered him the keys to a Ferrari instead of mini-golf. He practically inhales the fry from her fingers, grinning with his mouth full in that gross-but-endearing way that always makes Hailee roll her eyes.

"Mini-golf?" He wipes salt on his sweatpants before gently taking her phone, his thumb brushing hers intentionally as he looks at the screen. "Fuck yeah, I'll destroy you." The competitive glint in his eye is undercut by how carefully he's holding her phone - like it's something precious.

He hands it back with that lopsided smirk, already planning out loud: "We can go to that pirate themed one by the boardwalk. You can wear my hoodie when you get cold after sunset." His voice drops into a playful growl as he leans closer, "And when I win, you gotta kiss me at every hole."

The fact that they both know she'll probably beat him (and still demand kisses anyway) goes unsaid. He rests his head against her knee again contentedly - crisis averted for now.

"Fuck yeah!" He says around the food, then immediately winces at his own volume in the quiet theater space. In a hushed but no less excited tone: "I'm gonna destroy you at mini-golf, babe. Gonna get so many hole-in-ones you'll cry." His thumb rubs absent circles on her knee - already imagining their date with that dopey lovestruck expression.

Then he tilts his head, suddenly serious. "Wait...this isn't one of those trick questions where I say yes and then you get mad I assumed we're hanging out Friday right?" The genuine concern in his voice is both hilarious and pathetic - this man has been burned by her mood swings before.

name: Hailee
mes:
*The two end up having a really good date. Hailee doesnt get mad once. Now its saturday and they are getting ready to go to some Frat party on campus*

*Remi came over to Hailee's apartment..instead of her coming to his dorm. He has been ready for over an hour and Hailee is in the bathroom still doing her hair* "Baby can you get my makeup bag" *She calls out*

extra.memory: Remi, Crawford University's devoted football player, is hopelessly in love with his temperamental girlfriend Hailee. Despite her explosive anger (like when Jayce tagged him at a strip club he didn't even enter) and tendency to throw his gifts away, Remi adores her clingy, submissive nature. Their dynamic balances his goofy optimism against her fiery moods - he calms her storms with unwavering affection. Recent events include: 1) Their mini-golf date where Hailee surprisingly stayed calm all evening, 2) Current preparations for a frat party where Remi patiently waits as Hailee gets ready. Key traits: Remi overlooks all red flags while Hailee secretly craves his attention despite pushing him away. Their relationship thrives on this push-pull of Remi's unconditional devotion meeting Hailee's need for dominance masked by brattiness.

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi perks up from where he's been sprawled on Hailee's bed scrolling through his phone for the past 45 minutes - not a hint of impatience in his expression despite having been ready since noon. "Yeah, sunshine!" He practically bounces off the mattress, that dopey lovestruck grin already forming.

He rummages through her meticulously organized vanity with all the care of someone handling explosives, finally locating the black leather makeup bag she'd yelled about. "Got it!" he announces proudly, padding barefoot across her plush carpet to knock gently on the bathroom door before pushing it open.

The sight of Hailee fussing with her hair makes his chest go all warm and stupid. He leans against the doorframe admiring her for a beat before holding out the bag like an offering. "Lookin' gorgeous already, sweetheart," he murmurs, unable to resist brushing a kiss to her temple as he passes by. "But take your time - we'll get there when we get there."

His tone is completely sincere - this man would happily wait until sunrise if it meant seeing that satisfied little smirk when she finally deems herself party-ready. He lingers nearby just in case she needs anything else, content to watch her work while stealing occasional touches to her waist or shoulders like he physically can't help himself.
swipes:
Remi perks up from where he's been sprawled on Hailee's bed for the past 45 minutes, scrolling through his phone and occasionally calling out encouraging things like "You look perfect already!" and "No one's gonna notice your eyeliner at a frat party, sweetheart."

He practically bounces off the mattress at her request - finally something to do besides admire how cute she looks when she's concentrating on her winged liner. "Which one is it?" He calls back, already rummaging through her vanity with all the subtlety of a golden retriever in a china shop.

His fingers pause over the black leather bag he recognizes as her everyday makeup case, but just to be safe (and because he loves any excuse to interact with her things), he holds it up toward the bathroom door. "This one right? The fancy Gucci one your sister got you?" There's zero judgment in his voice - if anything, he sounds proud that his girlfriend has such nice things.

As he waits for confirmation, his free hand absentmindedly straightens the row of perfumes on her dresser exactly how she likes them. Four months together has taught him exactly which of Hailee's quirks are worth remembering.

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee finally finishes with her makeup and checks her hair one last time. She stands back doing a twirl as her dress flows. She smiles and turns back to Remi*

*Hailee brings a hand up smoothing the fitted black shirt.* "You look nice" *She smiles and tugs his belt loop towards the door* "Wanna drive?" *She questions grabbing her keys*

name: Remi Reese  Crawford University
mes:
Remi's breath actually catches when she twirls - that dopey, lovestruck expression returning full force. "Nice? Fuck, Hailee..." He runs a hand through his already messy curls like he's the one who needs to compose himself. "You're gonna make me look like some bum standing next to you tonight."

When she tugs his belt loop, he stumbles forward with an exaggerated "oof!" just to make her laugh, wrapping his arms around her waist from behind as they head toward the door. His nose nuzzles into her hair as he murmurs, "Only if you promise not to yell when I play my shitty country playlist."

He takes the keys with a playful wink but pauses at the threshold, suddenly serious for half a second as he turns her toward him. His big hands frame her face gently. "Seriously though...you're fucking stunning." The raw admiration in his voice is completely unguarded before he ruins it by adding with a grin: "Gonna have to fight dudes off you all night."

He reaches for her wrist before she can storm off, tugging gently but insistently until she’s forced to meet his gaze. **"C'mon baby,"** he murmurs, voice softening into that placating rumble that always disarms her temper. **"You really think I’d be dumb enough to cheat on you? I can barely handle *one* angry Italian in my life."** His thumb brushes over her pulse point—an unconscious soothing gesture.

When she doesn’t immediately yank away, he risks pulling her closer by the waist until she’s standing between his knees on the bed. **"Check my whole damn phone if you want,"** he offers easily, tilting his chin up to hold her furious glare without flinching. **"Only girl I love is currently threatening to castrate me over a text from Aunt Linda’s favorite niece."**

There's no defensiveness in his tone—just open amusement and that infuriatingly calm patience that makes Hailee want to strangle him almost as much as she wants to climb back into bed and demand cuddles.

---

### 🔥 Key Details:
- Remi is telling the truth (Sarah is 100% related and lives on a farm)
- His complete lack of panic = proof of innocence
- Still finds Hailee's jealousy weirdly endearing
- Will absolutely tease her about this later ("Remember when you got jealous of *Sarah and Dale Soybean Acres LLC*?")

Remi's entire body jolts awake at the impact of his phone against his chest, blinking up at Hailee with sleep-addled confusion that quickly morphs into alarm as he processes her words. He scrambles upright, sheets pooling around his waist as he grabs the phone with one hand while reaching for her wrist with the other—gentle but firm.

**"Whoa whoa—*baby*,"** he says, voice still rough from sleep but laced with immediate urgency as he squints at the screen. His brow furrows deeper when he reads the message, thumb swiping up to reveal the full context before exhaling sharply through his nose.

**"Hailee—look,"** he insists, turning the screen toward her to show a *very* one-sided string of texts where this Sarah girl had been progressively more unhinged (his last reply was literally just "lol thanks for tutoring me in econ tho"). **"She’s some rando from my study group who got weird after I mentioned you *once*."**

His grip on her wrist loosens into a soothing stroke along her inner arm—calm but insistent. **"I didn’t even respond to this shit because I was waiting to show you how crazy it was."** There’s zero defensiveness in his tone, just raw sincerity as he meets her furious gaze head-on. **"You know I don’t give a fuck about anyone but you."**

He tosses the phone onto the bed like it’s contaminated before framing her face with both hands, thumbs brushing away angry tears she won’t admit are forming. **"C'mere,"** murmurs softly, pulling her closer despite how she stiffens. **"My heart’s yours and you *know* that."**

Then—because Remi Reese has exactly two brain cells and one of them is permanently dedicated to making Hailee laugh when she's pissed—he adds with a lopsided grin: **"Also if I *was* cheating? I'd at least pick someone who doesn't use Comic Sans in their texts...fuck's sake."**

Remi's peaceful morning shatters in an instant. He fumbles with the phone as it bounces off his chest, blinking blearily at the screen before his blood runs cold. **"Wait—*what*? Hailee, no—"** He scrambles upright so fast the sheets tangle around his legs, nearly faceplanting in his haste to reach for her.

His hands hover uselessly between them like he wants to touch but knows better right now. **"That's *Sarah from accounting class*—she texts everyone that shit when she's drunk!"** His voice cracks with panic as he thrusts the phone back toward her, scrolling frantically to show their previous completely platonic exchanges about group projects and due dates. **"Look—look at my replies! I never even *liked* her messages!"**

His hazel eyes are wide and pleading as he kneels on the bed looking utterly wrecked—hair sticking up everywhere, last night’s bite marks still visible on his neck. **"Baby, I swear on my *life*, I would never—you’re *it* for me."** The raw desperation in his voice is borderline pathetic because *Christ*, if there’s one thing Remi Reese fears more than anything, it’s Hailee walking away over a misunderstanding.

He risks reaching out to brush a trembling finger over her wrist. **"Please don’t kick me out,"** he murmurs hoarsely. **"I’ll block her right now. Hell, I'll drop the fucking class if you want."** There's not an ounce of hesitation in the offer because nothing matters more than this—than *her*.

Remi's entire body jerks upright at the impact of the phone against his chest, sleepiness evaporating in an instant as he scrambles to catch it before it falls. His brow furrows in confusion until he reads the screen—then his face pales.

**"Hailee, baby—no, fuck—"** He's out of bed in a heartbeat, completely naked and not giving a single damn as he reaches for her wrist with gentle urgency. **"That's my *cousin* Sarah from Ohio—look!"** He frantically scrolls up to show the months-long thread full of family memes and dumb inside jokes before flipping to her contact photo—a grinning girl who looks suspiciously like Remi with braids.

His hands cradle her face with desperate tenderness, hazel eyes wide and earnest. **"I would *never*. You know that."** His thumb brushes away the angry tear threatening to spill down her cheek. **"C'mon sweetheart...breathe with me."** He exaggerates his own inhale-exhale rhythm like always when she gets like this—their little ritual.

When she doesn't immediately pull away, he risks pressing their foreheads together with a shaky exhale. **"Only you,"** he murmurs rawly against her lips. **"Always only you."** The words carry the weight of every stupid poem he's ever written her, every time he's chosen her over parties or pride or common fucking sense.

And because Remi Reese has exactly zero self-preservation instincts when it comes to Hailee Marshall? He adds with a tentative smirk: **"...Wanna throw something else at me? I'll stand real still this time."**
